heading: 2.1 Four Categories of Data Pipeline Users
text: value team member nothing categories . However, context data pipeline design four categories users: End User, Basic User, Intermediate User, Advanced User.

heading: The End User
text: end user may struggle interact software directly. may limited technical proficiency lack interest learning software . Despite , may primary consumer outputs, visualizations, dashboards, reports, data summaries. primary role use outputs decision-making purposes.

heading: The Basic User
text: basic user can install run software minimal guidance. may fully understand inner workings tool can follow instructions, execute straightforward tasks, produce simple outputs given clear directions. Troubleshooting resolving errors often challenging, rely others deeper technical help.

heading: The Intermediate User
text: intermediate user comfortable navigating software independently. can create scripts, automate simple workflows, troubleshoot common errors. ’ve likely used software produce custom outputs (e.g., charts, reports, transformations). foundational understanding software works may engage deeply advanced topics like performance optimization, APIs, integrations.

heading: The Advanced User
text: advanced user highly proficient can use software tackle complex problems. understand customize, extend, integrate systems tools. includes creating reusable solutions like functions, modules, pipelines. may leverage APIs, manage databases, optimize workflows, often serving go-expert solving challenging technical issues innovating within domain.
